attributes.action: Overturning the ban on Gays and Bisexuals Donating Blood
attributes.additional_details:
Gay and Bisexual men in the UK, who have engaged in sexual contact with other men (even with a condom) are not allowed to give blood for a year after this contact.

This is due to outdated studies that designate Gay and Bisexual men as a 'higher risk category'.

However, 42% of HIV and AIDS patients are Gay and Bisexual, compared to 49% of Heterosexual cases.

Please sign this petition to demand a review of these regulations.

rejection.details: Please see: Allow Gay Men to Donate Blood Freely
